verses.text: And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants unto Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father: for Hiram was ever a lover of David.
And Solomon sent to Hiram, saying,

Thou knowest how that David my father could not build a house unto the name of the \sc Lord\sc* his God for the wars which were about him on every side, until the \sc Lord\sc* put them under the soles of his feet.
But now the \sc Lord\sc* my God hath given me rest on every side, \add so that there is\add* neither adversary nor evil occurrent.

And behold, I purpose to build a house unto the name of the \sc Lord\sc* my God, as the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto David my father, saying, Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room, he shall build a house unto my name.

Now therefore command thou that they hew me cedar trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants: and unto thee will I give hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt appoint: for thou knowest that \add there is\add* not among us any \add that\add* can skill to hew timber like unto the Sidonians.

And it came to pass, when Hiram heard the words of Solomon, that he rejoiced greatly, and said, Blessed \add be\add* the \sc Lord\sc* \add this\add* day, which hath given unto David a wise son over this great people.

And Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, I have considered \add the things\add* which thou sentest to me \add for: and\add* I will do all thy desire concerning timber of cedar, and concerning timber of fir.

My servants shall bring \add them\add* down from Lebanon unto the sea: and I will convey them by sea \add in\add* flotes unto the place that thou shalt appoint me, and will cause them to be discharged there, and thou shalt receive \add them:\add* and thou shalt accomplish my desire, in giving food for my household.
So Hiram gave Solomon cedar trees and fir trees \add according to\add* all his desire.
And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat \add for\add* food to his household, and twenty measures of pure oil: thus gave Solomon to Hiram year by year.
And the \sc Lord\sc* gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him: and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon; and they two made a league \add together\add*.
And king Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and the levy was thirty thousand men.
And he sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month \add by\add* courses: a month they were in Lebanon, \add and\add* two months at home: and Adoniram \add was\add* over the levy.
And Solomon had threescore and ten thousand that bare burdens, and fourscore thousand hewers in the mountains;
besides the chief of Solomon’s officers which \add were\add* over the work, three thousand and three hundred, which ruled over the people that wrought in the work.
And the king commanded, and they brought great stones, costly stones, \add and\add* hewed stones, to lay the foundation of the house.
And Solomon’s builders and Hiram’s builders did hew \add them\add*, and the stonesquarers: so they prepared timber and stones to build the house.
